news.title: Clear stand on Sainik Farm, says Delhi HC
news.para: The HC pointed out that the matter of regularisation of Sainik Farm has been pending for nearly seven years and directed both the Centre and the Delhi government to take a decision.

news.title: Chandigarh: Colony No. 4 razed to reclaim 65 acres of forest department land
news.para: Over 2,000 security personnel, 10 duty magistrates, traffic police and other staff of different departments of the administration were deployed at the city’s oldest colony in Industrial Area, Phase I, for the operation that started early in the morning.

news.title: YEIDA to allow 42,000 allottees six months more to register plots
news.para: The beneficiaries have also been allowed to pay the outstanding amount in three instalments. The decisions were taken during the YEDA board meeting last week to provide relief to allottees who faced a financial crunch because of the pandemic.

news.title: YEIDA to earn Rs 413 crore from one-time pay plan
news.para: Between October and December last year, YEIDA had come out with the one-time settlement plan, giving relief to the allottees hit hard by the pandemic.

news.title: Mumbai property registration scales yet another peak with 11,744 deals in best-ever April
news.para: The country’s financial capital witnessed registration of over 11,744 property deals in April, making it one of the highest performances ever, showed data from the Inspector General of Registration, Maharashtra.

news.title: HDFC raises lending rate by 5 basis points; EMI to rise for existing borrower
news.para: "HDFC increases its Retail Prime Lending Rate (RPLR) on Housing loans, on which its Adjustable Rate Home Loans (ARHL) are benchmarked, by 5 basis points, with effect from May 1, 2022," the company said in a statement.

news.title: UP-RERA steps in to complete an abandoned project in Noida Sector 143
news.para: Launched in 2012, flats in Festival City were supposed to have been delivered by 2015. But the developer — M/s Mist Direct Sales Pvt Ltd — defaulted on the deadline and then stopped construction altogether.

news.title: Mumbai: Promises unkept, builder told to refund booking amount
news.para: Rapping a developer for terminating the booking of a flat, Maharashtra Real Estate Authority (MahaRERA) allowed its purchasers to withdraw from the project at Kandivli (west) and directed return of their entire amount paid, along with interest, within two months.

news.title: Chandigarh admin to decide on 50% property tax rebate to colony dwellers
news.para: Councillors of all political parties said that these arrears were not justified, particularly because people had not been informed on time when the tax was imposed a few years back and now suddenly, tax bills were sent with huge amount of arrears.

news.title: New Ghaziabad civic body panel rejects proposal for hike in house tax
news.para: “The house tax hike proposal has been rejected by the GMC executive committee. GMC had proposed to levy more tax on houses in affluent localities as compared to the less developed areas, but it now stands rejected,” a civic body official told TOI on Saturday.

news.title: Hyderabad civic body earns Rs 708 crore in property taxes
news.para: The GHMC counters saw significant q ueue lines on Saturday as residents tried to avail themselves of the scheme as it expires on April 30.

news.title: Chandigarh housing board eyeing big bucks from 123.79-acre land at IT Park
news.para: The CHB has decided to start e-auction of sites on the on the 123.79 acres of land acquired from Parsvnath Developers Limited for housing projects.

news.title: Chandigarh civic body's general house nod to sell properties on freehold
news.para: The matter will be sent to the UT administration for formal approval to the conversion to dispose of the properties not being sold for past over a decade despite multiple attempts owing to their leasehold nature.

news.title: Jaipur development body plans to issue 92,000 lease deeds in Shahar-II
news.para: An official said, “As per the plan, the JDA will issue approximately 6,000 lease deeds per month. The civic body has already carried out a survey and prepared a plan to distribute 67,000 lease deeds. The process to issue more lease deeds is underway.”

news.title: Chandigarh: Prospective bidders demand single-window clearance
news.para: UT chief conservator of forests (CCF) Debendra Dalai, CHB’s CEO Yashpal Garg, UT chief architect Kapil Setia, CHB chief engineer Rajiv Singla, CHB secretary Rakesh Popli and others clarified the issues raised by prospective bidders.
